entry.summary: Inuit (short for “**In**terface **U**sability **I**nstrumen**t**”) is a new questionnaire you can use to assess the usability of your user interface. It has been designed to be more diagnostic than existing usability instruments like, e.g., SUS and for use with machine learning, all the while asking fewer questions than other questionnaires. This article explores how and why Inuit has been developed and why we can be sure that it actually measures usability, and reliably so.

entry.title: How to Build Your First Web Component
entry.summary: In 2023, browser support for web components (also known as custom elements) is really good. There's never been a better time to start building your own custom elements. Web components, also known as custom elements, are new HTML elements that you create. These elements encapsulate some markup, style, and interactivity.

Daria shares her approach to digital product typography and reviews the key points to consider when choosing typefaces.
